title: Authors and Citation
text: Pukar Bhandari. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bhandari P (2025). pukRhelpers: Helper Functions 'pukR' Workflows. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://ar-puuk.github.io/pukRhelpers/, https://github.com/ar-puuk/pukRhelpers.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pukRhelpers: Helper Functions for `pukR` as in My Workflows},   author = {Pukar Bhandari},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://ar-puuk.github.io/pukRhelpers/},   url = {https://github.com/ar-puuk/pukRhelpers}, }

what: Helper Functions for `pukR` as in My Workflows
title: Helper Functions for `pukR` as in My Workflows
text: pukRhelpers collection helper functions designed streamline simplify workflows R. package compiles useful utilities ’ve used across various projects, providing convenience data manipulation, analysis, visualization tasks.

title: Helper Functions for `pukR` as in My Workflows
text: can install pukRhelpers package GitHub using one following methods, depending package manager prefer.

title: Helper Functions for `pukR` as in My Workflows
Helper Functions for `pukR` as in My Workflows
Helper Functions for `pukR` as in My Workflows
Helper Functions for `pukR` as in My Workflows
text: installation, load package :

title: Helper Functions for `pukR` as in My Workflows
text: ’ve installed package, can start using functions immediately. example using one functions pukRhelpers:

title: Helper Functions for `pukR` as in My Workflows
text: full list functions examples, check package documentation. convert_fgb_to_gdb(): Convert FlatGeoBuf (FGB) Files Geodatabase (GDB) Layers convert_xml_html(): Convert XML HTML using XSLT extract_html_table(): Extract table following specific anchor tag name attribute geo_split_lines(): Split Lines Maximum Length (Credit: dblodgett-usgs) load_esri(): Load Query ESRI Feature Service Layer load_kml_sf(): Convert KML Simple Features (sf) Object Preserved Attributes (Credit: mdsumner) load_packages(): Load Install R Packages load_ugrc_data(): Load Dataset UGRC SGID load_ugrc_vars(): Load List Datasets UGRC SGID st_aggregate(): Aggregate sf objects (Credit: rCarto) st_split_lines(): Split Lines Maximum Length (Credit: dblodgett-usgs)

title: Helper Functions for `pukR` as in My Workflows
text: Contributions welcome! suggestions improvements, feel free open issue submit pull request.

title: Helper Functions for `pukR` as in My Workflows
text: Fork repository. Create new branch feature fix. Submit pull request detailed description changes. Please ensure code adheres Tidyverse style guide passes unit tests applicable.

title: Helper Functions for `pukR` as in My Workflows
text: package licensed GPL-3 License. See LICENSE file details.

title: Helper Functions for `pukR` as in My Workflows
text: Thanks R community contributors inspiring building great packages made development pukRhelpers possible.

what: Convert FlatGeoBuf (FGB) Files to Geodatabase (GDB) Layers — convert_fgb_to_gdb
title: Convert FlatGeoBuf (FGB) Files to Geodatabase (GDB) Layers — convert_fgb_to_gdb
text: function converts FlatGeoBuf (.FGB) files within specified folder layers specified Geodatabase (GDB) file.

title: Convert FlatGeoBuf (FGB) Files to Geodatabase (GDB) Layers — convert_fgb_to_gdb
code: convert_fgb_to_gdb(   input_folder,   gdb_path,   overwrite = FALSE,   crs = "EPSG:3857" )

title: Convert FlatGeoBuf (FGB) Files to Geodatabase (GDB) Layers — convert_fgb_to_gdb
text: input_folder Character. Path folder containing FGB files. gdb_path Character. File path output GDB file. overwrite Logical. Whether overwrite existing layers GDB. Default FALSE. crs Character. Coordinate Reference System transform data. Default "EPSG:3857".

title: Convert FlatGeoBuf (FGB) Files to Geodatabase (GDB) Layers — convert_fgb_to_gdb

what: Convert XML to HTML using XSLT — convert_xml_html
title: Convert XML to HTML using XSLT — convert_xml_html
text: function applies XSLT transformation XML file saves output HTML file.

title: Convert XML to HTML using XSLT — convert_xml_html
Convert XML to HTML using XSLT — convert_xml_html
text: root character string specifying root directory XML XSL files located. xml_filename character string specifying name XML file. xsl_filename character string specifying name XSL file. output_filename character string specifying name output HTML file.

title: Convert XML to HTML using XSLT — convert_xml_html
text: function return value saves transformed HTML file specified output path.

title: Convert XML to HTML using XSLT — convert_xml_html

what: Extract table following a specific anchor tag by name attribute — extract_html_table
title: Extract table following a specific anchor tag by name attribute — extract_html_table
text: function extracts summary trip tables Warren TDM HTML file.

title: Extract table following a specific anchor tag by name attribute — extract_html_table
Extract table following a specific anchor tag by name attribute — extract_html_table
text: html_file character string specifying path HTML file. anchor_id character string specifying name attribute anchor (<>) tag locate.

title: Extract table following a specific anchor tag by name attribute — extract_html_table
text: data frame containing extracted table.

title: Extract table following a specific anchor tag by name attribute — extract_html_table
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ summary_table <- extract_html_table("Model.html", "id6") # View the extracted table View(summary_table[[1]])  trip_table <- extract_html_table("Model.html", "id52") # View the extracted table View(trip_table[[1]]) } # }

what: Split Lines by Maximum Length — geo_split_lines
title: Split Lines by Maximum Length — geo_split_lines
text: Splits LINESTRING geometries longer given threshold multiple smaller segments, ensuring segments threshold.

title: Split Lines by Maximum Length — geo_split_lines
Split Lines by Maximum Length — geo_split_lines
text: input_lines data.frame class sf containing LINESTRING geometries. max_length maximum length allowed segment. id name ID column input data.frame.

title: Split Lines by Maximum Length — geo_split_lines
text: data.frame class sf containing split LINESTRING geometries.

title: Split Lines by Maximum Length — geo_split_lines

what: Load and Query an ESRI Feature Service Layer — load_esri
title: Load and Query an ESRI Feature Service Layer — load_esri
text: function connects ESRI Feature Service, displays available layers ID provided, allows users download query specific layer.

title: Load and Query an ESRI Feature Service Layer — load_esri
Load and Query an ESRI Feature Service Layer — load_esri
text: furl Character string. URL ESRI Feature Service endpoint. ... Additional arguments passed arcgislayers::arc_select querying layer. id Integer, optional. ID layer download. NULL, available layers displayed, user prompted specify ID interactively.

title: Load and Query an ESRI Feature Service Layer — load_esri
text: sf object containing queried features selected layer.

title: Load and Query an ESRI Feature Service Layer — load_esri
text: function opens connection specified ESRI Feature Service, lists available layers id provided, downloads queries specified layer. Users can pass query arguments via ... filter results.

title: Load and Query an ESRI Feature Service Layer — load_esri
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Example 1: Load and query a specific layer by ID sf_data <- load_esri("https://sampleserver6.arcgisonline.com/arcgis/rest/services/USA/MapServer", id = 1)  # Example 2: Interactively select a layer sf_data <- load_esri("https://sampleserver6.arcgisonline.com/arcgis/rest/services/USA/MapServer") } # }

what: Convert KML to Simple Features (sf) Object with Preserved Attributes — load_kml_sf
title: Convert KML to Simple Features (sf) Object with Preserved Attributes — load_kml_sf
text: function reads KML file processes specified columns extract feature identifiers descriptive attributes, returning sf object retains geometry parsed attribute data.

title: Convert KML to Simple Features (sf) Object with Preserved Attributes — load_kml_sf
Convert KML to Simple Features (sf) Object with Preserved Attributes — load_kml_sf
text: kml_path character string specifying path KML file. path can local file URL, zipped files supported. ... Additional arguments passed sf::read_sf() reading KML file. id_col character string indicating column KML file contains feature identifiers (default "Name"). details_col character string specifying column contains descriptive data parsed (default "Description").

title: Convert KML to Simple Features (sf) Object with Preserved Attributes — load_kml_sf
text: sf object containing geometry parsed attributes extracted KML file.

title: Convert KML to Simple Features (sf) Object with Preserved Attributes — load_kml_sf
text: function parses details_col extract key-value pairs format "label: value", ensuring features consistent structure. missing values handled appropriately.

title: Convert KML to Simple Features (sf) Object with Preserved Attributes — load_kml_sf
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Example usage: # kml_file <- "path/to/your/file.kml" # result_sf <- load_kml_sf(kml_file) } # }

what: Load and Install R Packages — load_packages
title: Load and Install R Packages — load_packages
text: function checks specified R packages installed loads . package installed, attempts install specified CRAN repositories.

title: Load and Install R Packages — load_packages
Load and Install R Packages — load_packages
text: ... list package names installed /loaded. Names provided unquoted identifiers. silent Logical, default FALSE. TRUE, suppresses printing package loading statuses.

title: Load and Install R Packages — load_packages
text: named logical vector indicating whether package successfully loaded.

title: Load and Install R Packages — load_packages
text: function ensures specified packages installed loaded current R session. Missing packages automatically installed CRAN. function also provides option suppress output messages.

title: Load and Install R Packages — load_packages
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Example 1: Load and install ggplot2 and dplyr load_packages(ggplot2, dplyr)  # Example 2: Load packages silently load_packages(ggplot2, dplyr, silent = TRUE) } # }

what: Load Dataset from UGRC SGID — load_ugrc_data
title: Load Dataset from UGRC SGID — load_ugrc_data
text: Loads dataset UGRC SGID database. default, dataset returned sf object spatial data analysis.

title: Load Dataset from UGRC SGID — load_ugrc_data
Load Dataset from UGRC SGID — load_ugrc_data
text: table_name character string specifying name table retrieve (e.g., "schema.table_name"). as_sf Logical. TRUE (default), data returned sf object. FALSE, geometry column dropped regular data frame returned.

title: Load Dataset from UGRC SGID — load_ugrc_data
text: sf object data frame containing data specified table.

title: Load Dataset from UGRC SGID — load_ugrc_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load UTA Transit Lines uta_lines <- load_ugrc_data("transportation.uta_routes_and_ridership")  # Load UTA Transit Stops uta_stops <- load_ugrc_data("transportation.uta_stops_and_ridership") } # }

what: Load List of Datasets from UGRC SGID — load_ugrc_vars
title: Load List of Datasets from UGRC SGID — load_ugrc_vars
text: Retrieves list available datasets UGRC SGID database, including schema table names.

title: Load List of Datasets from UGRC SGID — load_ugrc_vars
Load List of Datasets from UGRC SGID — load_ugrc_vars
text: data frame containing two columns: table_schema table_name, listing schemas tables SGID database.

title: Load List of Datasets from UGRC SGID — load_ugrc_vars
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Check list of available datasets ugrc_vars <- load_ugrc_vars() View(ugrc_vars) } # }

title: Aggregate sf objects — st_aggregate
text: Geometries attributes aggregated. Source: https://gist.github.com/rCarto/bb47aff0a02e808d2bf64f2d8c5db7d8#file-st_aggregate-r

title: Aggregate sf objects — st_aggregate
Aggregate sf objects — st_aggregate
text: x sf object name variable grouping elements var name(s) variable(s) aggregate fun function(s) compute summary statistics

title: Aggregate sf objects — st_aggregate
text: sf object returned

title: Aggregate sf objects — st_aggregate
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(sf) nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package="sf")) nc$dummy <- "ZONE_A" nc$dummy[25:50] <- "ZONE_B" nc$dummy[51:100] <- "ZONE_C" r <- st_aggregate(nc, "dummy", c("BIR74", "NWBIR74"), c("mean", "median")) plot(nc) plot(r) } # }

what: Split Lines by Maximum Length — st_split_lines
title: Split Lines by Maximum Length — st_split_lines
text: Splits LINESTRING geometries longer given threshold multiple smaller segments, ensuring segments threshold. Source: https://gist.github.com/dblodgett-usgs/cf87392c02d73f1b7d16153d2b66a8f3

title: Split Lines by Maximum Length — st_split_lines
